sentence 1: Mr. Moncrieff visited Chester's luxurious New York apartment, thinking that it belonged to his son Edward. [SEP] sentence 2: Edward no longer requires his financial support.

sentence 1: By rolling over in her upper berth, Tatyana could look over the edge of it and see her mother plainly. How very small and straight and rigid she lay in the bunk below! Her eyes were closed, but Tatyana doubted if she slept. [SEP] sentence 2: How very small and straight and rigid Tatyana lay in the bunk below!
sentence 1: Anna did a lot better than her good friend Lucy on the test because she had studied so hard. [SEP] sentence 2: Anna had studied so hard.

sentence 1: Grant worked hard to harvest his beans so he and his family would have enough to eat that winter, His friend Henry let him stack them in his barn where they would dry.
